metadata.title: CVE-2018-20456 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In radare2 prior to 3.1.1, the parseOperand function insidelibr/asm/p/asm_x86_nz.c may allow attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash in libr/util/strbuf.c via a stack-based bufferover-read) by crafting an input file, a related issue to CVE-2018-20455.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-3.2 - 3.1.2+dfsg-1.1
libradare2-common - 3.1.2+dfsg-1.1
radare2 - 3.1.2+dfsg-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2+dfsg-1.1').
